obstruct.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to block a road, passage etc
obstruct.translation[0].definitions[0].e: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
The column obstructed our view of the stage.
obstruct.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to prevent someone from doing something or something from happening, by making it difficult
obstruct.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The group is trying to obstruct the peace process.
He was fined for obstructing the work of the police.
